snippet.title: The 3 Missing Teens Who Got CHAINED In Their Friends Dads Basement..
snippet.description:
i heard y'all wanted me to dive deeper... 🔦
welcome to my BRAND NEW channel 'ANNA UNCOVERED' 🚨
head over and watch my FIRST few videos and don't forget to subscribe if u enjoy!!
⚠️ WARNING this channel contains bone chilling true crime.. u might not wanna watch alone!!!
let me know if u were brave enough to watch until the end!! ⚠️ 
LINK BELOW! LOVE Y'ALL

LINK: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWLEUN6N34GqGaxxNQTAc3Q  

The 3 Missing Teens Who Got CHAINED In Their Friends Dads Basement..

Stay tuned for the strange case that happened around Lorain Avenue between 2002-2004 when three young women had vanished from the area! Subscribe to Anna Solves for more true crime.

Michelle Knight disappeared on August 23, 2002. The authorities assumed she’d left home because she was angry at losing custody of her son, and didn’t look that hard for her. Because she was basically an adult. After fifteen months, they even took her off the missing person database!

But the local disappearances continued to happen. On April 21, 2003, Amanda Berry disappeared the day before her 17th birthday. She’d been working at a Burger King, and had left there at about 7 pm that night. Nobody could find her.

Gina DeJesus was barely in her mid-teens when she was last seen at a payphone at 3:00 pm on April 2nd, 2004. Then she also vanished without a trace.

While the usual searches went on, mainly for the last two women, Amanda’s poor mom had eventually consulted a ‘psychic’. This fraud convinced her that her daughter had passed away. That’s so incredibly sad. 

While the links between the cases were slowly being made, it looked like no trace of them would ever be found. At least not until there was a totally unexpected revelation.

Charles Ramsey had lived in Lorain Street for a year. On May 6th, 2013, he was hanging out outside his house, eating a McDonalds meal, when something really crazy began to happen.

Thinking it was a domestic issue, Charles went over and tried to unlock the screen door for her, but couldn’t get it to open very much. So he kicked out the bottom of the door. The woman emerged, and she brought a young girl out with her. 

What the hell was going on?

Frantically, the woman explained to Charles that she’d been held prisoner in the house. This is her 911 call:

"Help me I’m Amanda Berry! I need Police! I’ve been kidnapped and I’ve been missing for ten years, and I’m here, I’m free now…"

She was one of the missing women! And the man who owned the house was a local man called Ariel Castro. So clearly he had something to do with her k*dnapping, right?

When he learned this, Charles was more shocked than anyone else. He had NO idea about any of it. He’d known Ariel Castro for over a year, and had frequently eaten barbeque with the guy. So this was basically the last person he’d have expected to do something so awful. Keep watching to find out how this tragic story ends...

#truecrime #disturbing #annasolves
